ResponsesInList.Title: UI Scalability for larger student enrollments
ResponsesInList.Text: One of the hallmarks of a good system is scalability. Moodle works well when there is a small learning population. It is however, more challenging and completely manually when there are large training audiences. I prepared a course that required SME review and feedback prior to release. The course has 55 different cohorts, two of which were the SMEs cohorts. I marked the other cohorts as hidden until the SMEs blessed the course's content for release. To unhide each of the cohorts was a complete maddening experience. One at a time and the screen bounced back to the top of the page. No Select All or Unhide All functionality. No letting the admin self-navigate in a very, long page (death scroll). No filters to quickly check that all cohorts were unhidden.

ResponsesInList.Title: comment on the content level
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am having trouble finding a good plugin that allows our platform to support comment sections for each content section of the course. For each resource, there's a comment section about that resource. Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: comment on the content level
ResponsesInList.Text: The core Comment Block does this for content level - add it to the course page, choose the "Any Page" setting, and it will treat the block as unique for the course page and for each activity. However, it does not treat course "Sections" as unique. A 3rd Party plugin to consider for Section pages might be: https://moodle.org/plugins/block_course_discuss - The advantage to this plugin is it puts the discussion "in" the content area instead of a "block" off to the side ( IF your theme supports that).

ResponsesInList.Title: comment on the content level
ResponsesInList.Text: thank you for the reply it was very helpful, though i would like to know if there's an option where the comment section always get created when a content is created, so i don't have to create it manually each time.

ResponsesInList.Title: comment on the content level
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, once the "Comment Block" is added to the course page with the "any page" setting enabled, then all newly added activities would countinue get a copy of that block. For the 3rd party plugin, I do not think so, I think it has to be manually added to each activity, but I've not used it so I can't say for sure. But if you can download it to try it out, then I'd say treat it like the "Comment Block" by try adding it to the course page with the add to "any page" setting (then, add a comment into it on the course page, such as "Course Page Test". Then, add a new activity to the course and see if it that 3rd party plugin automatically is inside the new activity, and see if it is 'blank' or if it includes that "Course Page test" comment.

ResponsesInList.Title: Learning plan templates
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe that my Moodle experience is quite different than other Administrators, as I am the only person who comments on the lack of functionality in the Learning Plan Templates (LPT), Learning Plans (LP) and Competencies. Most days, I shrug my shoulders and carry on. Today (yes, this is a rant) I spent over three hours building a learning plan for a new student. this student has unique competency requirements, so it could not be duplicated from an existing LPT. This one single, student has 106 competencies. Adding each competency is an extremely manual process, but worse than that the Learning plan Template view has no automated ordering capabilities. None. Each competency has to be moved, manually using a UI that looks for like a DOS screen than a modern UI. Just having some method for automated ordering would save me hours every week.

ResponsesInList.Title: Learning plan templates
ResponsesInList.Text: It's way easier with the enrol_Programs plugin, including block_programs. The official version is already enough for most cases. I customized a lot in the plugin and also created an extension for it to fulfill our organizational needs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Add option to control course display on the front page in course settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Description Currently, there is no option in the course settings to specify whether a course appears on the Moodle front page for non-enrolled users, even when the course is visible. This requires global configuration changes or moving the course to hidden categories, which is cumbersome for teachers. Proposed Improvement Add an "Show on front page" option in the course settings with: Yes : Course appears on the front page for users with permission . No : Course is visible only to enrolled users and does not appear on the front page. Site default : Follows global site settings.
